Articles.Content:
Hi guys!

Are you ready for The Kerbin Sattelite Retrieval Challenge?

Easy as pie, it is. Using (hopefully) no more than two (2) crews total, not only must you put a sattelite in

orbit around Kerbin, but you will have to bring it down again. The challenge is scored on an easy system,

so by showing screenshots, or even better, a mission video, we can all revel in the awesomeness of the

objectively most awesome astronauts and engineers Kerbin can muster.

Here\'s the scoring:

1 point for putting a sattelite in orbit.

1 point for getting the sattelite back to Kerbin. (on a separate launch)

1 point for not killing more than 6 astronauts. (2 crews)

5 points for only using 3 astronauts (1 crew)

5 points for bringing down the sattelite less than 1 km from KSA

10 points for bringing the sattelite down to Kerbin in one piece (as in: not explode)

1 point for screenshots OR 2 points for mission video

Post your story/pictures/mission video and your score here. Can you manage 20 or more points,

and have your astronauts join the elitest of the elite?

P.S. Mods are fully allowed, but if you want to use a radio controlled ship, you must first use your astronauts for comsat-deployment.

P.P.S. Initial deployment of sattelite MUST be done by astronauts.

P.P.P.S. Be creative and resourceful when it comes to bringing down a sattelite in one piece. Using robot claws are encouraged.

Let the challenge begin!

P.P.P.P.S. Feel free to post a message if you\'re embarking on the challenge,

and to give feedback on whether or not it seems doable, too hard, too easy etc.
